channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bonds are rising as stocks suffer February drop. But don’t count on long-term bonds as a cushion.
item.description: Bonds are up so far in February, outperforming U.S. stocks ahead of upcoming inflation data.

item.title: More traders turn bullish in first quarter even as market shows signs of fatigue, Schwab survey says
item.description: The bulls continue to outnumber the bears among traders 51% to 34%, even though two-thirds of respondents said the market is overvalued, per Schwab's ...

item.title: GM raises dividend and unveils $6 billion buyback program to cheer weary shareholders
item.description: Uncertainty about tariffs and labor-cost headwinds have weighed on stock this year

item.title: Investors love Buffett and then ignore what he says. How to avoid these mistakes made in 2024.
item.description: Larry Swedroe, author of several investing books, talks about the biggest mistakes investors make year after year, and how they can break the cycle.

item.title: Biotech Breakthrough: TLX Surges 20% on Illuccix PSMA-PET Imaging Agent Approval

item.title: Bernstein upgrades Alibaba thanks to AI, calls for shares to rally more than 20%
item.description: Optimism around artificial intelligence could mean big gains in Alibaba shares, according to Bernstein.

item.title: Eli Lilly cuts price of weight-loss drug Zepbound as competition heats up
item.description: The drug company is calling on insurers and federal programs to cover obesity as a chronic disease.

item.title: Lowe’s stock jumps as same-store sales rise for first time in 2 years
item.description: Lowe’s reported quarterly results that beat expectations but gave a downbeat full-year outlook a day after rival Home Depot did the same.

item.title: Some 'Trump trades' are starting to roll over as the stock market sputters
item.description: Small caps and industrials are among the stock groups that are now down since Election Day.

item.title: Cash yields more than 4% as markets become rocky. How to get the best use of this asset in your portfolio
item.description: Cash instruments can be steady investments with solid income, but investors should be thoughtful about their allocations.
